Posts.Content: Hi I'm not sure if I am posting this in the right place - my apologies if not. I am currently coming to the end of my breast cancer treatment (chemo and radiotheraphy) following a lumpectomy last December and I'm worried that I've found a new lump.  It's right next to the scar, so may just be scar tissue but I'm really worried!  I'm trying to get an appointment with a doctor tomorrow but in the meantime, I wondered if anyone knows whether it's possible to get another tumour whilst having chemo? Thanks for listening! Tonia xxx
Posts.Title: New lump?

Posts.Content: Hi Panda68 thanks so much for taking the time to reply! It sounds like we've just gone through exactly the same treatment! Fingers crossed both our worries are unfounded and our minds will be put at rest. Be good to hear how you get on. Take care xxx
Posts.Title: New lump?

Posts.Content: Hi Petrina so glad you've got the appointment confirmed. Keeping everything crossed for you. Please let me know how you get on and try not to worry in the meantime (easy to say I know) - fingers crossed it's just scar tissue. It's great that they're being so thorough xxxxx
Posts.Title: New lump?

Posts.Content: Hi Mistmoley Thank you so much for sending a message so quickly.  The FEC and tax treatment ended in the Summer, but I then had 33 radiotherapy sessions and am now just having control Herceptin. I'm sure that you're right, but as you say, it's always best to get these things checked out.  Cancer has certainly made me paranoid about everything! Thanks again xxx
Posts.Title: New lump?

Posts.Content: Hi Panda68 & Petrina So sorry for the delayed response and thanks so much for your messages.  Panda68 - it's good that they're being so thorough. I saw my surgeon who did an ultra sound and said that it was just a build up of scar tissue. I wish to be honest now that I'd also had a mammogram just to put my mind at ease completely. Please let me know how you get on. Wishing you all the best xxxx Do you have your appointment booked yet Petrina?
Posts.Title: New lump?

Posts.Content: Hi Petrina Could it be connected to lymph node removal from the lumpectomy perhaps? I can't imagine it could come back after all the treatment.xxx
Posts.Title: New lump?
